title: <form>
description: The `<form>` HTML element represents a form, which is a collection of form controls (such as `input`, `textarea`, `button`, `select`, etc.) that allow users to submit data to a web server.
content: The element that is used to collect user input through various controls like text fields, checkboxes and buttons. The data entered in a form can be sent to a server for processing, making it a key element in user interaction on the web.
